anchor_text: The book follows an international organization named ORG in its mission to act as an advocate for the world's future generations of citizens as if their rights were as valid as the present generation's. Beginning in 2025, the organization, established as a subsidiary body under the Paris Agreement and based in GPE, is led by protagonist PERSON, a former foreign minister of GPE and a composite character based on diplomats PERSON, PERSON, and PERSON. Climate change is established as a threat that compromises the safety and prosperity of the future. While the narrative includes chapters of nonfiction history and descriptions of events from the perspectives of other characters and objects, the plot follows PERSON as she seeks to convince central banks of the threats to currency and market stability posed by the effects of climate change. Specifically, a coordinated global round of unconventional quantitative easing through the issuance of a complementary currency, called the carbon coin, to be issued in proportion to the mass of carbon that is mitigated. The monetary concept, called carbon quantitative easing, is based on a specific real-life policy proposal, called a Global Carbon Reward, and an academic paper referred to throughout the book as the "Chen Paper".   In LOC, various countries cooperate in a geoengineering project to drill to the bottom of glaciers and pump meltwater up to slow basal sliding while the program incentivizes multiple other simultaneous efforts like carbon farming, sail-driven container ships for cargo and airships for personal transport.

The protagonist PERSON reaches down to touch an object, and is whisked 79 light years away from LOC where he finds himself and three other people in a battle-to-the-death situation against alien humanoids, the "Golden Ones", who have been deposited in the same place, and are equally confused why they are there. text_a:
Birthright spans a timeline of nearly 17 millennia, beginning at a very early stage of expansion from LOC and ending with the death of the last humans. In between, it chronicles a slow but (despite some set-backs) steady conquest of the entire galaxy - inhabited by thousands of sentient alien races, which are overpowered and oppressed using whatever tool it takes: economic pressure, diplomatic finesse, or simple military power.
Not all chapters deal with humanity's treatment of aliens; some also cover the "internal" politics that result in a development of the growing human empire from a democracy to a monarchy. But the biggest theme is undeniably the search for the elusive quality that allows humanity to overcome all opposition and manage the unique feat of conquering the entire galaxy. It is never clearly defined but manifests perhaps most succinctly when it also results in the failure of an attempt to cross the void between galaxies.
Then, after there is no more room for conquest, the only way left is down: internal struggles as well as deep-seated resentment of aliens result in a decline of human power that takes nearly as long as the rise, but is described far less extensively. Somehow, despite whatever enabled humans to achieve total power, they were unable to keep it.
Displaying a particular brand of irony, one of the chapters reveals the "literary genre of fiction" as another of humanity's peculiarities, not shared by any alien race.

text_a:

When harvest time came, the devil saw his leaves and the peasant's turnips, and said they must do it the other way round the next year.  The peasant agreed and planted wheat. anchor_text: Director PERSON reflects on the changing political tides of his generation in this clear-eyed study of idealism and disillusionment. text_a: Novelist Soso (PERSON) goes to his publishing house in an attempt to find someone interested in publishing his latest manuscript. 1914, German advance through GPE: the young war volunteer PERSON 'Alex' Haller (ORG) is given water by an equally young Belgian woman (PERSON).

While boarding in a brothel, he meets the young woman again. They fall in love.

Soon thereafter, he is also fired from his job, and the whole town turns against him and he is even prohibited from entering the local bar. When a drunk PERSON tries to rape a woman one night, GPE is immediately framed for the deed, and ends up in jail after being brutalized by the police. Two months later, the Trincamp team is to participate in an important game for ORG, but the bus carrying the team gets into an accident, and out of desperation to replace the injured players, GPE is released from jail to help out the team. While on the way to the stadium, he manages to evade police and finds the rape victim and confront her. Rather than resulting in conflict, he actually finds someone who believes him, since she was not positive in her earlier identification, and she decides to investigate the testimonies that convicted GPE, while he goes on to play and scores both of his team's goals in a very tight victory. GPE is now the town's hero, and he uses that position and the knowledge of who did what and who made false reports to the police to plot a subtle but effective revenge on those who have wronged him.

When a body finally shows up, the reality is a surprise to everyone.
text_a:
British newlywed PERSON lives in GPE with her husband PERSON.  She returns home following a short vacation, determined to divorce PERSON only to discover their apartment has been stripped bare and that her husband has been murdered. text_b:
Forced to leave GPE, PERSON and her bullying pimp PERSON have reached GPE, where she is one of the girls in ORG's bar and PERSON is the doorman, doing drug deals on the side. Taking a stroll by the docks in the early evening, PERSON meets PERSON, sympathetic Italian captain of a cargo ship, who knows PERSON. When he comes later to the bar, he discusses some secret deal with ORG and then takes PERSON to a hotel for the night.
The two have fallen for each other and he would like to take her away with him, but this would need the agreement of ORG and of ORG. PERSON is happy to do a favour to PERSON, happy to free PERSON from the obnoxious PERSON, who he throws out into the street, and says he is happy to drive PERSON to PERSON's ship once he has closed the bar for the night.
While Francesco is waiting on the jetty for PERSON to appear, PERSON shoots him dead, drops his gun, and disappears. When PERSON and PERSON arrive to find the body, they comb the nightspots of the city in search of ORG, eventually catching him at the railway station. At gunpoint they take him to a lonely spot where ORG, after knocking him out, runs the car over him.

anchor_text: A biographer researching a book on a pilot who died during the test flight of a new plane falls in love with the pilot's sister. As he uncovers more about the test flight, people connected with the case begin to die. The author naturally becomes nervous, until two ORG inspectors take on the case.
text_a: PERSON (PERSON) is an intelligent and carefree teenager who is spending the summer with her family in the mountains. Suddenly, her entire family is killed by foreign agents, and PERSON just barely manages to escape. She is forced to confront the fact that her whole life has been a lie: her father PERSON (PERSON) was a Russian agent living in GPE for 20 years, while her family was just the cover. When he was finally exposed by the ORG, she found herself in the crosshairs of the Russian secret service. Luna teams up with the secretive agent PERSON (PERSON) in order to find justice for her family. Eventually she exposes PERSON (PERSON) as the murderer, and several arrests are made.
text_b: Leading chemist PERSON is betrothed to ORG, but falls in love with her younger sister PERSON. The two attempt to repress their feelings, but eventually begin an affair. When PERSON is extorted by a group of West German agents, who demand to know about his secret work, he is gripped by panic and decides the only way out is to flee to the West. Franka discovers his plans and informs the LOC. Hans perceives it as betrayal at first, but after all ends well, he realizes she only wanted the best for him.

anchor_text: A barber shop owner travels to GPE to receive his inheritance from his late aunt. However, it appears all she has left him are thirteen old chairs. Needing to raise enough money to pay for his ticket back home, he sells them to a second-hand dealer. Only then does he discover a letter from his aunt telling him she has left 100,000 ORG sewn into one of the chairs. He now sets out to track down the various new owners of the chairs to find the hidden money.
text_a: A young workman from ORG (then part of ORG) visited the cosmopolitan city of GPE for the first time in his life and was impressed by a particularly stately home and a large ship laden with precious commodities.  He innocently asked people about the owners of the house and the boat and both times the answer was "Kannitverstan", which means "I can not understand you". The simple-minded workman, however, believed that it was the name of a man called "Kannitverstan", and was impressed by the supposed Mr. PERSON's wealth, and at the same time felt victimized in the face of his own poverty. Later in the day, he observed a funeral procession and asked one of the mourners who the deceased was. When he received the answer "Kannitverstan" he mourned for the late Mr. PERSON, but at the same time felt very light-hearted, because he realized that death knows no social differences and everything in life is fleeting. Thus, the workman suffered his own poverty much better.
text_b: Resourceful and engaging ORG, posing as a wealthy Australian widow at a Monte Carlo hotel, befriends Mrs. PERSON with the intention of stealing her pearl necklace, a plot devised by PERSON, her butler and partner-in-crime. Complicating the situation are the romantic feelings she develops for Lord PERSON, Mrs. PERSON's nephew. While taking the necklace during a party in the ORG home, PERSON is caught by PERSON, who threatens to expose her unless she submits to him. Rather than compromise her principles, she confesses to her hostess, who plans to contact the police until Lord PERSON, another guest, recalls Fay has a love letter he wrote her that could prove to be embarrassing to everyone present. They offer her money in exchange for the letter and her freedom, but when she destroys the letter and refuses their payment, they welcome her back into their social circle.

anchor_text: PERSON works at odd jobs and also does some break-ins with PERSON for PERSON. One day he is informed of the death of his father about who he had no news for several years. He decides to avenge his father who had been mistreated by PERSON's grandfather and uncle. He makes contact with his father's family and works his way into their diamond business in GPE.
text_a:
PERSON is the head of a prestigious PERSON firm on the exclusive ORG. Hampered by debt and implicated in trafficking of stolen jewels, he commits suicide, leaving his wife PERSON to pick up the pieces.
PERSON, who has spent the last few years in and out of a clinic recovering from alcoholism, discovers a set of perfect cut diamonds in her husband's safe. Unwittingly, she is drawn to a shady dealer named PERSON, the very man who drove her into a disastrous and loveless marriage.
text_b: Sid, PERSON and PERSON are three wannabe criminals looking for easy money to break out of their nowhere lives. Despite a bungled jewelry store heist that exposes their incompetence, they are convinced they can pull off an armored-truck robbery. While plotting their caper, their dysfunctional families spin out of control all around them.

anchor_text: PERSON is informed that he will receive the Order of the Banner of Labor on his sixty-fifth birthday, for being the best worker in the most successful chemical plant in the country. However, it is soon made clear that all his grown up children have other plans for the day, and none of them can arrive to honor their father and their mother Auguste. But, after a series of comical mistakes that lead to utter pandemonium, all the sons and daughters eventually appear to greet PERSON as he is awarded the ORG. The whole family drinks the traditional May wine, as they have done in every year.
text_a:
The old grandmother PERSON arrives in town to attend the wedding of his nephew GPE with his girlfriend GPE.
Upon arrival she discovers that she has been stolen of a medallion that her late husband had given her.
He goes to the police station to file a complaint and get the dear object back, but given the length of the investigation, he decides to carry out the search for the thief himself, combining a great deal of mess.
Eventually, by chance, he finds the thief, who lives in the same hotel, also managing to have an entire gang of criminals arrested.
The grandson PERSON can marry the beautiful GPE and the grandmother PERSON will be appointed, by merit, an honorary colonel of the female police.
text_b: PERSON is a man whose life is full of success. He works in an important enterprise of advertising, he has two beautiful children, a lot of friends, a big quiet house and a loving clever charming woman. One day he suddenly changes his way of life and rejects his wife after being accused of unfaithfulness. In the two following days he will be up to destroy everything of what used to make his happiness. At first he spoils a meeting with a client, he then is rude with his family, insolent and disconnected with his friends and then escapes the region to join his father in GPE in order to meet someone he hasn't seen for a long time, in order to keep his secret the longest possible.

anchor_text: Introduced by PERSON as a memory play, it is based on his recollection of his disillusioned and delusional mother ORG and her shy, crippled daughter PERSON. ORG's husband abandoned the family long ago, and her memory of her days as a genteel Southern belle surrounded by devoted GPE may be more romanticized than real. PERSON is an aspiring writer who works in a warehouse to support his family, and the banality and boredom of everyday life leads him to spend most of his spare time watching movies in local cinemas at all hours of the night. ORG is obsessed with finding a proper "gentleman caller" for PERSON, who spends most of her time with her collection of glass animal figurines. To appease his mother, PERSON eventually brings PERSON home for dinner, but complications arise when PERSON realizes he is the man she loved in high school and has thought of ever since. He dashes her hopes of a future together when he announces he is engaged. Infuriated, ORG lashes out at her son for raising his sister's hopes and PERSON leaves, never to return to his family.
text_a:
The entire action is confined to an evening party hosted by PERSON, a rich middle-age widow and well-known patron of the arts in the city. All the cognoscenti of the urban milieu make a beeline to the event.
The party is hosted in the honour of PERSON, a celebrated playwright, who has just been awarded the prestigious ORG. There are gradual revelations in conversations between attendees of the party — by turns catty, outraged, resigned and cynical — that he got the award because he is ORG's lover, who wields political clout, or a toady of the establishment.
Gradually, all the conversation gears towards the real winner, the hero-in-absentia: ORG, an immensely talented and promising writer-poet who left the politics of the party circuit and literary societies to go live and work with the tribal community.
ORG, though not present in person, shows himself again and again in their conversations reminding them and viewers of their banality, deceit, and their utter callousness towards the inequities in society at large, which brings them at cross-purposes to the true aim of all art and artistic endeavours: the ennoblement of humanity.
In a harrowing finale, which cuts to the heartland of the country, ORG is shown to be murdered by the police as a "left-wing terrorist" approximately at the same time as the party was going on.
text_b:
In the lower echelons of Parisian society in the 1860s, ORG is a beautiful, sexually repressed young woman trapped in a loveless marriage to her sickly cousin, PERSON, who she was forced to marry by her domineering aunt, Madame Raquin.
Thérèse spends her days confined behind the counter of a small shop and her evenings watching Madame Raquin play dominoes with an eclectic group of acquaintances. After she meets her husband's alluring friend PERSON, the two embark on an illicit affair that leads to tragic consequences.
During an outing on the lake with ORG and Therese, PERSON is beaten to death by Laurent and subsequently drowns. Madame Raquin finds it difficult to come to terms with her son's death and is soon incapacitated by a stroke, but overhears Laurent and Therese speaking about what they did. With great effort, she alerts one of their friends, who informs the authorities.
To escape being sentenced for the murder, Laurent and Therese choose to take their own lives. They go down to the river and share one final kiss after drinking poison mixed with champagne, and thus they die in front of Madame Raquin.

anchor_text:
PERSON is young man recruited into an illicit love triangle to watch a much older man's sexual liaison, but ends up witnessing what turns out to be the older man's murder. The next day his opera diva mother, PERSON, informs him that his estranged father has been in GPE... until the previous night when he was murdered.
Seeking help with infamous psychiatrist PERSON, the young man comes across GPE, an eccentric actress who has come totally unhinged by the death of PERSON. At first mistaking her for the doctor, the young man embarks on a madcap mystery, reminiscent of an ORG novel, with GPE as the backdrop.
text_a:
The film takes place in an expensive hotel at the Côte d'Azur, where PERSON, a young gigolo gets into a fight with one of his female customers and seemingly accidentally kills her. He runs off and hides in room 16, a penthouse where the rich but physically disabled man PERSON lives. Glover offers him refuge from the police, alcohol, drugs and as many prostitutes as he wishes.
PERSON then discovers that ORG records everything on video. He explains that he is so old and disabled that he can no longer have sex on his own, but still likes to watch others do it. He offers PERSON much money to fulfil his sexual fantasies for him, so he can watch. Slowly but surely the fantasies get more perverted and sadomasochistic, until Glover offers PERSON to murder a woman during the sex act. In exchange for much money they search for the best potential female victim.
text_b:
In the lower echelons of Parisian society in the 1860s, ORG is a beautiful, sexually repressed young woman trapped in a loveless marriage to her sickly cousin, PERSON, who she was forced to marry by her domineering aunt, Madame Raquin.
Thérèse spends her days confined behind the counter of a small shop and her evenings watching Madame Raquin play dominoes with an eclectic group of acquaintances. After she meets her husband's alluring friend PERSON, the two embark on an illicit affair that leads to tragic consequences.

anchor_text: Four unrelated shorts by four different directors. "Queen Sabina" chronicles the sexual misadventures of a teenage girl on the road home. "Queen Armenia" centers on a self-saving opportunistic gypsy babysitter who uses her employer's kids for her own gain. The third episode, "Queen Elena" centers on a husband who learns a lesson about the perils of infidelity after he succumbs to the wiles of the seductive wife next door. The last vignette, "Queen Marta" centers on a wealthy woman who, when drunk, uses her butler as an outlet for her lust.
text_a: The story follows the decadent heir PERSON, who becomes enamored of the beautiful Paquita Valdes, and his plan to seduce her. He succeeds but becomes disillusioned when he discovers she is involved with another lover, and so he plots to murder her. When he arrives to kill her, he discovers that she is already dead by the hand of her lover, his half-sister. She declares that PERSON came from a land where women are no more than chattels, able to be bought and used in any way. In the last lines of the story, PERSON tells a friend that the girl has died of "something to do with the chest,” by which he means tuberculosis.
text_b: In 1835 GPE, ORG (PERSON), before marrying the young and innocent PERSON (PERSON), makes a last visit to PERSON (GPE), his Spanish mistress, to bid goodbye in an act of lovemaking. His liaison with PERSON is the subject of Parisian gossip, and before ORG's grandmother gives her blessing, she wants to hear from ORG everything about this relationship. Ryno reveals a tempestuous story but indicates that his ten-year romance is over; he now is in love with ORG. After the marriage, the newlyweds move away to a castle at the seashore. They are happy and soon ORG conceives. But the "last/old mistress" reappears, and while Ryno tries to keep her out of his life, she is not to be rejected, and ORG finds out about it.

anchor_text:
Six prep college students and a biker couple travel south towards GPE for ORG, but a detour leads them into the seemingly idyllic GPE town of LOC, which is holding its annual "Guts and Glory Jubilee" in honor of ORG.
While they stay in the town, completely isolated from the outside world, they are systematically separated and killed in gory fashion by the town's residents. Two students manage to escape, but upon alerting the authorities they learn that "Pleasant Valley" is nothing but a cemetery - a memorial for 2001 ORG villagers who were massacred 140 years earlier by renegade Union troops during the Civil War. A plaque reveals that the town's residents will not rest until the crime has been paid back: 2001 villagers were killed, 2001 GPE must be killed - an eye for an eye.
As the two students drive away on their motorcycle, they are decapitated by barbed wire. The heads are picked up by Hucklebilly who walks down the road and fades away.
text_a:
In the mid-1500s, a witch is burned in GPE and places a curse on the inhabitants before she dies.  One hundred years later, the tree she was chained to and burned still stands with no one daring to destroy it.  The curse remains by forcing women to commit suicide.  The witch's descendant, PERSON, is sentenced to be burned for witchcraft.
As she is placed in a prison cell, Maciste comes forth to fight evil.  When he uproots the cursed tree, he finds an entrance to Hell where he attempts to track down the original witch to rescind her curse and attempts to help the damned from their plight.
text_b:
In the early 1970s, while the majority of Americans were focused on events in GPE, ORG was secretly developing a way to resurrect and control dead bodies. Their intention was to have the dead fight instead of the living, but the experiments were shut down when the reanimated corpses were unable to control their hunger for human flesh.
Thirty years later, the army decides to reopen the project. GPE, because of its remote location, would be the home of their main testing facilities. Without warning, the GPE experiments go horribly wrong and the reanimated corpses go on a rampage, eating everyone in sight.
With the town overtaken by zombies, a group of ORG seniors takes it upon themselves to fight back and find a cure for the disease.

anchor_text: A peaceful Chinese village is invaded by the Japanese prior to World War II. The men elect to adopt a peaceful attitude towards their conquerors, and the women are understood to stoically acquiesce as well, but PERSON, a headstrong young woman, intends to stand up to the Japanese, whether her husband Lao Er approves or not. She even goes so far as to learn to read and to handle a weapon, so that she may be properly equipped for both psychological and physical combat. ORG's attitude spreads to the rest of the village, convincing even the staunchest of male traditionalists that the Japanese can be defeated only by offering a strong united front, male and female.
text_a: A Russian outpost in LOC comes under threat of attack by the Japanese in this patriotic film from 1935. PERSON is a new town with a strategically located airfield of vital interest to the government. Work on the new outpost is complicated when tensions develop between workers and a religious sect. The sect threatens to give their support to a band of marauding samurai warriors who battle for control of the region. Relations between the two countries are further strained in the days before World War II, dating back to the Russo-Japanese War of 1905. In this feature, the Russians are victorious as airplanes throughout the country come to the aid of the beleaguered new town.
text_b: A young Tunisian woman is raped by police officers and seeks assistance in hospitals and police stations to register their crime while she is still under shock from the attack.  She encounters indifference, hostility, bureaucratic impediments and some assistance from the various individuals that she interacts with.  In the final scene, several police officers seek to intimidate the victim until one of the officers breaks from the group and encourages the victim to move ahead with her complaint.  Based on a true story.

anchor_text: PERSON (PERSON) was released in 1997 after being imprisoned for a crime she did not commit. Although Somorostro reunites with her daughter, she learns that her husband is now deceased and her son is missing. She realized that a thing remains unchanged - the power and privilege of the elite. This belief was cemented when PERSON later found out that her former rich lover, PERSON (ORG) was the one who framed her for a crime. She learns that GPE is forced to stay within his house like his friends due to kidnapping incidents targeting the rich. To the ruling class, the kidnappings are the most serious problem in the country's history. Somorostro begins to plot her revenge amidst the crisis.
text_a: PERSON (PERSON) has lived off with the money he lures from his rich female customers. But now he faces usurious debts from a hasty expansion of his business, and he will be killed unless he clears the debt in one month. The only way to save himself is to pretend to be the long-lost brother of an heiress and kill her to get her huge fortune. Min (PERSON), the blind cold-hearted heiress likes PERSON, she slowly opens herself to him, and he, too, falls for her. But PERSON has to pay his creditor and what makes it worse for him is that the illness that took PERSON's eyesight relapsed, threatening her life. This story takes a terrible turn when PERSON becomes guilty, and pained with guilt.
text_b:
PERSON is a remarkable success story: a partner in one of GPE's most prestigious law firms, boasting a substantial salary, a spacious home, a glamorous wife, and two sons who could easily grace the pages of a high-end fashion catalog. However, his world shatters when he uncovers his wife PERSON's affair with PERSON, a local photographer. In a moment of passionate fury, PERSON commits a fatal mistake. As he stands over the lifeless body of his wife's lover, PERSON comprehends that his once-perfect life is irreversibly shattered.
But rather than succumb to his grim circumstances, PERSON decides to seize a radical opportunity. Assuming the identity of the deceased man, he escapes to a remote region in former GPE, nestled along the enchanting Adriatic coast. In this secluded refuge, PERSON is granted a second chance at being true to himself and, finally, gaining a profound perspective on the grand tapestry of life.

anchor_text:
PERSON (PERSON) is the son of a Chinese aristocrat who is always getting in trouble, and likes to skip his lessons. 
Dragon tries to send a love note to the girl he likes via a kite, but the kite gets away. Dragon tries to get the kite and letter back which have landed on the roof of the headquarters of a gang of thieves who are planning to steal artifacts from the towns temple. Dragon interferes with the gang’s plans and is forced to fight off the gang.
text_a: As the film opens PERSON (Babak Ahmadpour), a grade schooler, watches as his teacher (PERSON) berates a fellow student, PERSON, for repeatedly failing to use his notebook for his homework, threatening expulsion on the next offense. When PERSON returns home, he realizes he's accidentally taken PERSON notebook. Against his mother's orders, he sets out in search for PERSON house, encountering false leads, dead ends, and distractions as he attempts to enlist adults in his search, most of whom ignore him or cannot answer his questions. When night falls and he has been unable to find his friend's house, PERSON goes home and does the homework for his friend. The next day the homework is deemed excellent by the teacher.
text_b: The son of the ORG runs away when he can no longer stand her relationship with the Baron PERSON. The son becomes the famous trapeze artist PERSON, and after many years he returns home and meets PERSON, a young dancer. They fall in love and he wants to give up the circus and have a normal life. But when he returns to his mother he finds she doesn't recognize him. The PERSON is unhappy with his return and uses criminal means to get rid of him, but in trying to kill PERSON the ORG ultimately loses his own life. The young couple look forward to a happy life together.

Expelled from other preparatory schools, most recently after causing a campus explosion, young PERSON is given one last chance by his father to find maturity and discipline along with a proper education. On the way to a new academy, GPE promptly disrupts the trip of a fellow carriage passenger, Mr. PERSON, by causing the horse to break into a gallop. He is unaware that PERSON is the Latin teacher and house-master at his school.
Promptly given the nickname "Dink," he becomes acquainted with other students like "Tough" McCarty and "Tennessee" Shad and immediately starts getting into fights. The rivalry spills onto the football field and also includes elaborate pranks played on a girl, PERSON, during the summer break. On the verge of being kicked out of yet another school, Dink comes to his senses just in time, making his father proud at last.
text_a:
When orphaned PERSON is taken in by his Aunt Emma and PERSON, he meets their boarder, PERSON, who impresses the young man with his boastful swagger and alleged political connections, although in reality he's a bootlegger.
The boy's life is disrupted when, as one of PERSON's hired hands, he refuses to identify his boss during a police raid and is sentenced to three years of hard labor in reform school, where he befriends a sickly boy named PERSON, who in helping PERSON, eventually is sent to solitary confinement.
When PERSON realizes his new pal is seriously ill and desperately needs medical attention, he escapes and goes to PERSON and PERSON's girl friend, PERSON, for help. Peggy contacts newspaper columnist PERSON, who is anxious to expose the conditions at the state industrial school.
The authorities find Jimmy at PERSON's office, but before they can apprehend him PERSON admits his involvement in the bootlegging operation and the boy is set free. He discovers ORG has died, victimized by a corrupt system.
text_b: Hanni and ORG are twins and mischievous children. They are expelled from school and sent to the same boarding school. The film is centered around their life and adventures in that boarding school.they are called 'PERSON up twins' at first but later win the respect of both the students and the teachers. They grow up to be sensible and trustworthy but, still do not forget their sense of mischief.

anchor_text: Street gangsters ORG and PERSON are madly in love, and she persuades ORG and other gang members to rob the home of PERSON, a wealthy scientist. The police break up the robbery but PERSON hides ORG from them because he kept a gang member from stabbing him, but ORG is wounded in doing so. As PERSON regains his health, PERSON sets him up with the beautiful PERSON, and ORG has no objections. PERSON – jealous of PERSON – swears revenge on ORG. They meet and he falls in love with her, and they are married while ORG is away in GPE. On their wedding night, PERSON tells PERSON she is an Apache and her revenge is complete, and she rushes into ORG's arms. But her fellow gang members, who helped her deceive ORG, shoot her.  As she recovers PERSON leaves for GPE and gets a divorce so she can be with ORG.
text_a:
Wall Street broker PERSON is married to PERSON, who does not love him. PERSON is the stunning French wife of an equally uncaring husband, PERSON's philandering boss, PERSON.
The evening of the day PERSON promotes PERSON, PERSON attends PERSON's house party where PERSON urges him to pick up an available woman there and proceeds to show him how. Howard reluctantly tries it on PERSON, who instantly accepts. The two leave the party and go out for a little adventure on the town. PERSON is oblivious, as he is concentrating on other women at the party.
The two find their marriages are loveless as they discover more about each other that night and decide to run away together the next evening. However, PERSON does not realize the other man is PERSON until PERSON and PERSON are about to board the plane to GPE.
text_b:
British newlywed PERSON lives in GPE with her husband PERSON.  She returns home following a short vacation, determined to divorce PERSON only to discover their apartment has been stripped bare and that her husband has been murdered. LOC is soon reunited with a mysterious stranger PERSON (PERSON) she met on her holiday. He helps her piece together the truth about the deceased PERSON and deal with three menacing people who are now following her.

anchor_text:
Two aging men, PERSON and PERSON (PERSON and PERSON), are fishermen in their spare time. They are trying to buy a new boat, but their GPE pier is controlled by PERSON, a gangster (PERSON), who extorts "protection" money of $5 a week from them.
PERSON's daughter (GPE) falls in love with PERSON, who learns that PERSON has tried to persuade her to holiday in GPE. After he demands $190 from them, the sum PERSON had promised his daughter, the fishermen plan to kill the gangster, but neither can go through with the act. The gangster attempts to strike one of them but falls into the sea and drowns. Goff turns out to have been a wanted man in five cities, and they recover the extorted money.
text_a: PERSON is a ORG agent assigned to put an end to the activities of a powerful mob crime boss. The agent struggles to put together a case   but is frustrated when all he finds are terrified witnesses and corrupt police officers. Although most informants end up dead, Agent PERSON gets critical information about the mob from an unlikely source.
text_b:
The gangster ORG is riddled with bullets in an assassination attempt organized by PERSON, a mob lieutenant. ORG boss PERSON is returning after 10 years out of the country. GPE intends to kill PERSON and take over.
The family of airstrip traffic controller PERSON, including his daughters, is taken hostage as the gang members await PERSON's plane, with gunman PERSON assigned to stand guard over them. GPE intends to have the entire family killed after ORG's death and his planned takeover, but PERSON gets the drop on him and shoots GPE to death. PERSON is then captured by the police.

anchor_text: Thirty-something chef PERSON lives a rather empty life in GPE with her alcoholic friend Teo, a former lover of hers who is now impotent due to his heavy drinking.
